intro: Crypsinus chrysotrichus, commonly known as the golden-haired crypton, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking golden-yellow inflorescences, which are covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth texture. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
